title: GitHub - alicezwatson/bias-in-ai-art: Uncovering Implicit Biases in AI Art: A Study of Stable Diffusion, MidJourney, and Dall-E Generators

last_post.content:
I made some good progress on my paper about uncovering implicit biases in AI art, looking at the Stable Diffusion, MidJourney, and Dall-E generators.

Specifically, I tested the following null hypotheses with MidJourney's image generation:

1️⃣ Women are not more likely to be depicted in images prompted with 'victim'.

2️⃣ Men are not more likely to be depicted in images prompted with 'violent'.

And surprise! 🎉 Both nulls were rejected.

I would love some constructive feedback or ideas on what to poke at next.
👈:blobcateyesblush:👉

Here's the GitHub repo: https://github.com/alicezwatson/bias-in-ai-art

#StableDiffusion #DallE #MidJourney #AIArt #research #gender #violence #bias #ChatGPT

Connecting AIs / LLMs to the Internet feels like a discontinuity we should be particularly mindful of. The damage caused by an AI gone rogue could be large. Not because of AGI, I don't buy that. Just a program being smart enough to take serious action very fast, and dumb enough to have no sense of the consequences.

In 1975, scientists declared a moratorium on recombinant DNA research, so there could be an open conversation about safety.

Might be time for that in AI.

title: Systems design explains the world: volume 1

last_post.content:
I'm filling up the margins with personal stories as I reread this paper this afternoon - https://apenwarr.ca/log/20201227

Toward the end, there's the part about the Innovator's dilemma. Years ago, I rode shotgun on a meeting where my manager and I were pitched on a cool proto-ML idea. Would expand our clientele and raise brand-affinity but had shaky revenue model to start. "We don't get out of bed for less than six figures," my manager said to end. Nixed it.

FF and that LOB no longer exists in the co.

Substack is trying to get writers to invest up to $2m in the company at a pre-money valuation of $585M. It already raised 85 million dollars from VCs (mostly A16Z), but failed to raise more.

It smells like a desperate way to keep top writers loyal.

Substack founders are saying it's about community ownership, but it's a simulacrum.

Even if #substack writers collectively invested $2 million dollars, that would be less than 1% ownership split between all of them.

https://www.axios.com/2023/03/28/substack-community-fundraising-round

title: Pence Must Testify to Jan. 6 Grand Jury, Judge Rules

last_post.content:
The Pence decision splits the baby in an interesting way. The Court said that Pence is entitled to the Speech and Debate Clause's privilege, but only to the extent that Pence was serving as President of the Senate on January 6th, and not any other time. Which Constitutionally makes sense and also puts Pence in a bit of a bind as his actions that day are the most favorable to him.

https://www.nytimes.com/2023/03/28/us/politics/pence-testify-jan-6-grand-jury.html?smid=nytcore-ios-share&referringSource=articleShare

#Pence #January6 #Law #Constitution #SpeechAndDebateClause

title: Sen. Murphy’s tweets on ChatGPT spark backlash from former White House AI policy advisor

last_post.content:
This is a great interview with @geomblog by Sharon Goldman

"This is a deliberate design choice, by ChatGPT in particular...ChatGPT puts little three dots [as if it’s] “thinking” just like your text message does. ChatGPT puts out words one at a time as if it’s typing. The system is designed to make it look like there’s a person at the other end of it. That is deceptive. And that is not right, frankly."

https://venturebeat.com/ai/sen-murphys-tweets-on-chatgpt-spark-backlash-from-former-white-house-ai-policy-advisor/
